document.docAuthor: Ye, Bao-Hua, Yin, Zhan & Li, Xin-Jiang
document.docTitle: Haplotropis xiai Ye, Yin & Li, 2016, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of the genus Haplotropis Saussure, 1888 (Orthoptera, Acridoidea, Pamphagidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of the genus Haplotropis Saussure, 1888 (Orthoptera, Acridoidea, Pamphagidae) from China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype : ♂, paratypes
2 ♂
, 2 ♀, Shandong, Taishan, Tiaohuayu,
36 º 16 ´N
,
117 º05´E
,
2005 -VI- 7
, collected by Lu Mei-Rong, Fang Fu-Ming and Li Chun.

Male: Body large size (
Fig. 1
a). Head large and short, shorter than pronotum. Face slightly oblique in profile. Frontal ridge widened at median ocellus (
Fig. 1
e). Antennae filiform, 25 segmented, mid segments of antennae 4.0 times as long as wide. Eyes globose, vertical diameter 1.4 times horizontal diameter and 1.3 times subocular furrow. Pronotum cylindrical, anterior margin angular in middle, median keel distinct, not cut by hind transverse sulcus, lateral keels absent. Length of interspace of mesosternum longer than its length of the narrowest part(
Fig. 1
d), lateral lobes of metasternum separated. Tegmina shorter, reaching the hind margin of first abdominal tergite, length 2.3 times its width, covered 2 / 5 tympanum (
Fig. 1
f). Upper keel of hind femur smooth, length of hind femur 3.6 times its maximum width, the end of lower knee lobes angular. Hind tibia with 9 spines on inner and outer sides, external apical spine present. Second joint of hind tarsus shorter than first joint. Tympanum distinct, big and rotundity (
Fig. 1
f). Krauss’ organ washboard-like, length 1.7 times width of mid-part (
Fig. 1
b). Tergum of terminal abdomere with longitudinal groove in middle, furculae absent. Cercus conical, not reaching tip of epiproct, apical half part gently tapering. Subgenital plate short-tapered, apex obtuse. Ancorae of epiphallus oblique inward slightly, lower margin with high projection in the middle (
Fig. 1
c).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Haplotropis xiai
sp. nov.
a. body in lateral view ♂; b. Krauss’ organ ♂; c. epiphallus; d. mesosternum ♂; e. frontal ridge ♂; f. tegmen and tympanum ♂; g. head and prontum, in dorsal view ♀; h. mesosternum♀; i. body in lateral view ♀; j. end of abdomen in ventral view ♀.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female: Body more robust (
Fig.
1
i). Vertical diameter of eyes 1.4 times horizontal diameter and 1.1 times subocular furrow. Anterior margin of pronotum with distinct acute angular in middle (
Fig. 1
g). Length of interspace of mesosternum shorter than its length of the narrowest part(
Fig. 1
h). Tegmina shorter, not reaching hind margin of the 1 st abdominal tergite, length 2.1 times its width. Length of hind femur 3.4 times its maximum width. Cercus short-conical, not reaching end of epiproct. Length of subgenital plate shorter than width (
Fig. 1
j), both sides of subgenital plate straight. Ovipositor valve slender, apex curved and acute, outer margin smooth.

Coloration: Body brown. Antennae yellowish-brown. Pronotum yellowish-brown, with a black longitudinal band along median keel. Tegmina brown. Hind femur with two black band on upper side. Hind tibia yellow, upper side blue. Abdomen yellowish-brown, with dark broad longitudinal stripe on both sides. Subgenital plate brown in male.

Measurements (mm): Length of body: ♂ 29.9−32.1 , ♀ 38.3-39.6 . Length of tegmina: ♂ 4.5−5.8 , ♀ 5.1–5.6 . Length of pronotum: ♂ 9.7−11.1 , ♀ 12.3–12.5 . Length of hind femur: ♂ 13.8−14.8 , ♀ 17.1–17.8 .

Diagnosis. The new species
Haplotropis xiai
sp. nov.
is similar to
Haplotropis brunneriana
Saussure, 1888
. The major differences are listed in
Table 1
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Comparison of
Haplotropis xiai
sp. nov.
and
H. brunneriana Saussure, 1888
.

tr.td: Lower margin with high projection in the middle
Lower margin with low projection in the middle
Anterior margin with distinct acute angular in middle
Anterior margin with small obtuse angular in middle
is named in honor of Prof. Kai-Ling Xia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype : ♂, paratypes
1 ♂
, 2 ♀, Hebei, Zhuolu,
39 º 59 ´N
,
115 º 10 ´E
,
2002 -VII- 4-12
, collected by Li Xin-Jiang and Cui Wen-Ming.

Male: Body large size (
Fig. 2
d). Head shorter than pronotum. Face slightly oblique in profile. Frontal ridge widened at median ocellus (
Fig. 2
a). Antennae filiform, 22 segmented, mid segments of antennae 4.0 times as long as wide. Eyes globose, vertical diameter 1.4 times horizontal diameter and 1.3 times subocular furrow. Anterior margin of pronotum angular in middle, reaching hind margin of eyes, median keel distinct, not cut by hind transverse sulcus, metazona with lateral keels. Length of interspace of mesosternum shorter than its length of the narrowest part (
Fig. 2
c), lateral lobes of metasternum separated. Tegmina shorter, extending over the hind margin of first abdominal tergite, length 1.6 times its width (
Fig. 2
g). Upper keel of hind femur smooth, length of hind femur 3.4 times its maximum width, the end of lower knee lobes angular. Hind tibia with 9 spines on inner and outer sides, external apical spine present. Second joint of hind tarsus shorter than first joint. Tympanum distinct, big and rotundity. Krauss’ organ washboard-like, length 1.7 times width of mid-part (
Fig. 2
b). Tergum of terminal abdomere with longitudinal groove in middle, furculae absent. Cercus conical, not reaching the tip of epiproct. Subgenital plate short-tapered, apex acute (
Fig. 2
h). Ancorae of epiphallus oblique inward distinctly, lower margin with high projection in the middle (
Fig. 2
e).

Female: Body more robust (
Fig.
2
i). Vertical diameter of eyes 1.6 times horizontal diameter and shorter than subocular furrow slightly. Anterior margin of pronotum reaching hind margin of eyes(
Fig. 2
f). Tegmina shorter, not reaching hind margin of the 1 st abdominal tergite, length 1.3 times its width. Length of hind femur 3.3 times its maximum width. Cercus short-conical, not reaching end of epiproct. Subgenital plate oblong, length longer than width, both sides of subgenital plate straight (
Fig. 2
j). Ovipositor valve shorter, apex curved, outer margin smooth.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Haplotropis zhuoluensis
sp. nov.
a. frontal ridge ♂; b. Krauss’ organ ♂; c. mesosternum ♂; d. body in lateral view ♂; e. epiphallus; f. head and prontum, in dorsal view ♀; g. tegmen and tympanum ♂; h. end of abdomen in lateral view ♂; i. body in lateral view ♀; j. end of abdomen in ventral view ♀.

FIGURE 3.
Haplotropis
brunneriana
Saussure
, 1888
(adopted from Storozhenko et Paik, 2011). a. body lateral view ♂; b. frontal ridge ♂; c. tegmen ♂; d. proonotum in lateral view ♂; e. end of abdomen in lateral view ♂; f. end of abdomen in dorsal view ♂; g. epiphallus ♂; h. head and prontum, in dorsal view ♀; i. mesosternum ♂; j. Krauss’ organ ♂; k. end of abdomen in lateral view ♀; l. body in lateral view ♀; m. end of abdomen in ventral view ♀.

subSubSection.paragraph: Coloration: Body brown. Antennae yellowish-brown. Pronotum yellowish-brown, with a black longitudinal band along median keel. Tegmina brown. Hind femur with two indistinct dark bands on upper side. Hind tibia yellow, upper side blue. Abdomen yellowish-brown, with dark broad longitudinal stripe on both sides. Subgenital plate brown in male.

Measurements (mm): Length of body: ♂ 32.5−34.1 , ♀ 41.6–42.7 . Length of tegmina: ♂ 5.4−6.2 , ♀ 6.0– 6.2 . Length of pronotum: ♂ 11.2−12.1 , ♀ 13.1–13.8 . Length of hind femur: ♂ 13.8−14.5 , ♀ 16.8–17.8 .

Diagnosis. The new species is similar to
H. xiai
sp. nov.
, the major differences are listed in
Table 2
.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Comparison of
Haplotropis zhuoluensis
sp. nov.
and
H. xiai
sp. nov.

tr.td: Anterior margin reaching hind margin of eyes
Anterior margin not reaching hind margin of eyes
Length 1.6 in male and 1.3 in female times width
Length 2.3 in male and 2.1 in female times width
Ancorae oblique inward distinctly, lower margin with high projection in the middle
Ancorae oblique inward slightly, lower margin with low projection in the middle

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology The specific epithet is named for Zhuolu the type locality.
